meta.name: description
meta.content: View Giulio Marescotti's professional profile on LinkedIn. LinkedIn is the world's largest business network, helping professionals like Giulio Marescotti discover inside connections to recommended job candidates, industry experts, and business partners.

body.class: guest v2 public-profile chrome-v5 chrome-v5-responsive sticky-bg guest

div.p: Software Engineer

div.p: As a LinkedIn member, you'll join 250 million other professionals who are sharing connections, ideas, and opportunities.

div.p: 10+ years of experience in the whole software development life cycle, from software design to development, test, bug fixing, integration and validation, adopting both Waterfall and Agile methodologies. A passionate adaptable worker with strong skills in C++, Java, scripting, Design Patterns, revision control systems and web designer. Competent user of the tools/framework Eclipse, Visual Studio, ASP.NET and Django. Solid knowledge of relational database and telecommunications. Some experience with CMS Wordpress, PHP; digital Hardware and VHDL.

div.class: position first experience vevent vcard summary-current
div.p: Privately Held; 1001-5000 employees; Automotive industry

December 2013 – Present (5 months)
Genoa Area, Italy

Development of a Warehouse Management System for industrial batteries
Design of a Web Page to provide sales, production and warehouse department, with tools to register and track the state of the batteries manufactured by FIAMM. The system stores life cycle of batteries data through all stages from creation to disposal.
• Design of Database schemes to model batteries' internal data, the current state, the warranty details and client ́s notes, in Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio
• Management of profiles and accounts to authorize selectively the departments to operate, in ASPX and C#
• Design of Web pages to display, filter and modify batteries' data at any stage of the life cycle, in ASPX and C#
[Tools: ASP .NET, C#, ASPX, MS Visual Studio 2012, MVC4, Microsoft SQL Server 2008, JQuery]
Privately Held; 10,001+ employees; Defense & Space industry

December 2012 – December 2013 (1 year 1 month)
Genoa Area, Italy

Wide Band Data Link (WBDL) a high speed communication system for ISR (Intelligence Surveillance and Reconnaissance) application
High speed data link system for aircraft to connect to ground terminal for transmission of data, videos, images, voice and metering. Software design, development and documentation provided applying project specific CMMI processes.
• Writing of software requirements, traceability, use-case and test-case of WBDL, using IBM DOORS
• Software Design with UML, using IBM Rhapsody
• Development of a simulation tool to automate feature ́s tests of application SW. Simulator emulates external actors and run test-cases, applying the Behavior-Driven Development (BDD), using the tool (Cucumber-like) Behave with Python, and Eclipse on Windows platform
• Web page design to run and monitor test-cases reports, using Django Framework, MySQL and MVC pattern
• Nightly build system ́s installation, configuration and integration, with Jenkins
[Tools: Django, Eclipse, BDD-Behave, Jenkins, C++, Python, Json, Rhapsody, VxWorks Workbench, Design Pattern, Lua dissector]
Public Company; 10,001+ employees; ERIC; Telecommunications industry

May 2010 – December 2012 (2 years 8 months)
Genoa Area, Italy

Product upgrade and Maintenance of an Operational Support System (OSS) for Ericsson networks
Development of new features, Bug Fixing and code refactoring of OSS. Scrum and Kanban Agile ́s software development methods adopted
• Java GUI and server to provide customers with tool to order and install licenses to unlock the desired features for the Node/Network, using Eclipse, Spring and Swing
• Implementation of OSI Alarm Severity Assignment Profile (ASAP), in C++
• Refactoring of alarms history storage server system, improving the throughput
• Code analysis, Bug Fixing, testing and developments of scripts to reproduce major bugs conditions
[Tools: Java, Spring, RMI, C/C++, scripting, ClearCase, Eclipse, Quantify/Purify/Coverity Rational IBM tools, Design Patterns, Agile methodology, Fuse file system, C++ Wireshark dissector]
Public Company; 1001-5000 employees; Transportation/Trucking/Railroad industry

July 2009 – May 2010 (11 months)
Genoa Area, Italy

Upgrade of SSA, a rail traffic management system
SSA code re-factoring to comply with the new, more robust and reliable, textual database of local trains data. Development of another task to update SSA with the data contained in files received every day containing variations of national train database. The task spots changes between those files and the train timetable (provided by the national Supervision/Management system), transmits sync messages to SSA using the BUSSW, a proprietary Corba like system offering remote services
• Script development to synchronize SSA (through BUSSW), merging changes from national train database, in Tcl
• Development of a Web page for railways personnel to supervise the actions performed by tool
• Development of a task "bridge" to synchronize SSA with SCC, two rail traffic management system that use custom data formats.
• Development of a Web page to display the whole database of local trains data
• Development of a Web page to spot and highlight contingent errors in the SSA database possible due to mistake in personnel manual operations, using Tcl Apache module
[Tools: Apache, Html, CSS, JavaScript, Tcl, C++, CORBA]
Public Company; 10,001+ employees; ERIC; Telecommunications industry

April 2007 – July 2009 (2 years 4 months)
Genoa Area, Italy

Bug fixing and upgrade of IP-based multi-service access nodes EDA2510/30
Bug Fixing for maintenance of ADSL, voice and controller boards of EDA25XX, a Broadband Access Network device managing traffic (data, IPTV and voice) through SDH (Ethernet and optical fibers) and ADSL + H248 line interfaces. Code analysis, trouble reports reviews in different level of customer assistance. Boards run Linux distribution.
• Bug Fixing for issues on the software of the main card involving software download, some SFP from specific vendors and diagnostic engine software, in C++
• Development of diagnostic tools to reproduce and analyze uncommon major troubles mainly with compact flash and bus communication among boards, in scripting languages
• Teacher in training session of Tcl programming Language to provide a small audience (in internal Ericsson) with instruments to develop an application to automate the execution of test-cases
• Development of a driver to manage new DWDM SFP modules
• Porting of SW to implement NTP synchronism, in C++
[Tools: C++, Tcl, NTP, SFP, SNiFF+, Linux]
Public Company; 10,001+ employees; ALU; Telecommunications industry

January 2007 – April 2007 (4 months)
Milan Area, Italy

Evolution of Hybrid Bridge System of 4th generation
Development of 4th generation Bridge device. The network component implements the new features T­MPLS and runs Linux Montavista on any board.
• Developing of Timer utilities to port SW from pSos to Linux
• Developing of simple remote shell using POSIX threads
[Tools: Posix, C, T-MPLS, Ethernet]
Public Company; 5001-10,000 employees; Medical Devices industry

March 2006 – January 2007 (11 months)
Modena Area, Italy

Validation of software for Prisma and Phoenix, two Dialysis machines
Development of a simulator to qualify the algorithm that controls the weight of patients treated with dialysis therapy on Prisma. Control loop activates pumps and reads the weight scales of liquid ́s bags. Creation of graphics software models to allow tester software to stimulate algorithm and check the feedbacks. Software Qualification of the renal product Phoenix to comply with national and international standard required.
• Simulator development, creating graphical widgets, of the weight ́s control algorithm of Prisma. Tailoring and Porting of algorithm on Windows PC, using Windows/CVI
• Development of a tool to stimulate the algorithm simulator running the test-cases for Prisma and creating XML reports, in Python using COM objects
• Writing of test-cases and documents needed to validate both the algorithm and the simulator itself, of Prisma
• Code Inspection of based on PC-LINT report and code review, for Phoenix
• Development of a Web page to report the results of the code inspection on Phoenix
[Tools: Windows CVI, XML, HTML, XSLT, COM, PC-LINT, C++, Python]
Privately Held; 1001-5000 employees; Telecommunications industry

November 2004 – March 2006 (1 year 5 months)
Genoa Area, Italy

Test and Validation of the Store Management Unit of NORIDC and NH90 helicopters
Validation of SMS (Store Management Software) for the store management unit (SMU), an automatic procedure manager of helicopter NORDIC. Writing of Software Design Description documents with UML and Specifications. Test and Validation of the Store Management Unit (SMU) for NH90 helicopter, using DOORS and Rational Rose tools. Development of test software (ETS), and writing of specifications to check every possible failure conditions of SMU on NH90.
• Reverse Engineering from NORDIC source code to create UML diagrams and compile the Software Design Documents, using Rational Rose tools
• Development of a simulator of TCS (Tactical Control System), the central system that controls the SMU, through bus 1553, using Borland C++
• Development of a Simulator of SMS for NORDIC on Windows PC, to execute the test-cases, using Cygwin, Tcl and COM objects
• Verification of test-case on SMU (with ETS) of NH90 with the Test Equipment provided by Augusta company
• Development of a GUI to execute the tests on SMU (with ETS) via bus 1553, using Visual C++
[Tools: Visual C++, Borland C++, ADA, Cygwin, STD-MIL-1553, Rational Rose, DOORS, UML]
Privately Held; 1001-5000 employees; Telecommunications industry

June 2004 – November 2004 (6 months)
Genoa Area, Italy

Test of DVS (a speed meter for aircrafts) and the Tornado aircraft.
Test execution of Doppler Velocity Sensor (DVS) part of helicopter NH90. DVS measures the velocity of helicopter along the 3 axis of his trajectory. Unit Test of the new software release of Tornado aircraft to achieve 100% coverage.
• Manual execution, verification of tests and writing of reports on DVS, through ARINC interface
• Development of a Web Page to display the reports of DVS tests execution
• Script developing to achieve 100% coverage on Tornado, in Rational Test Realtime
[Tools: XML, XSLT, VBA, Rational Test Realtime]

October 2003 – June 2004 (9 months)
Pisa Area, Italy

Upgrade of Tetra Base Station, a network node for military and civilian mobile communications
Development of SW for the new version of TETRA Base Station. Development of firmware and drivers, using VxWorks 5.5.
• Development of BSP (Board Support Package) from scratch.
• Device drivers for Disk-On-Chip, SPI, AMD flash and DSP TMS320Cxx
• Porting of Tetra software from pSos to VxWorks
[Tools: Tornado 2.2 Suite, PowerQUICC II, VxWorks 5.5, SPI, flash, C, Tetra]
Public Company; 10,001+ employees; Telecommunications industry

February 2001 – February 2003 (2 years 1 month)
Genoa Area, Italy

Design of MSH-2K, a high capacity network node (1 year 3 months)
Software of the main-board to implement the OSI-protocols LAPD, ISIS, ESIS, LLC and Ethernet.
• Porting of OSI-SW (developed by RETIX) to the new architecture and RTOS (pSos)
• SW to redirect LAPD (DCC) channels over UDP sockets toward Traffic Cards
• SW to Configure the Traffic Cards, through TCP/IP sockets
• Development of a tool, on host PC, to test communication protocol of traffic cards, via Ethernet, using Tcl
• Development of a Web page to monitor the real-time state of device
[Tools: Apache, HTML, Motorola Power-PC, media switch Intel, pSos, C, Tcl, Windows NT]
Test of the STM64C, a traffic card carrying SDH with DWDM feature, for Marconi network equipment (9 months)
Development of firmware to test the board carrying SDH (with STM-64), and supporting the new feature Out Of Band with FEC (Forward Error Correction).
• Design and Development of loop-routine to control the unstable optical amplifier
• Development of a text-based GUI to monitor real-time alarms
[Tools: Motorola MPC8260, pSos, C/C++, Ncurses]
Public Company; 10,001+ employees; SI; Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing industry

September 2000 – February 2001 (6 months)
Milan Area, Italy

SRA-L upgrade, a point to point radio system
Upgrade of the SRA-L, a low capacity digital radio system, with improved hardware and new features as the selectable capacity.
• Development of software to manage the new radio alarms and the new hardware with improved bandwidth
[Tools: Borland C++]
Privately Held; 1001-5000 employees; Telecommunications industry

November 1997 – September 2000 (2 years 11 months)
Milan Area, Italy

OPM (Optical Peripheral Module) a data and voice node in an optical SDH network (2 years 3 months)
Development of API (Application Interfaces) for traffic cards to provide hi-level software with
facilities to access the SDH functions up to VC-12 container.
• Writing of the API specification
• Development of API to implement SDH, in C
• Development of API to implement the performances, in C
• Design of a GUI to display the real-time alarm ́s status, in Tcl/Tk
[Tools: C, Tcl, PowerPC, VxWorks, Tornado Suite]
Test of SDH STM-1 board with ATM (7 months)
Firmware to test a SDH/STM-1 board implementing the ATM Physical layer.
• Driver development for SDH chip (Sierra)
• Software to test functions of SDH and ATM (through UTOPIA interface)
• Real-time menu to monitor STM-1 alarms via serial line
[Tools: Motorola 68302, Sierra PMC5437, C]
Public Company; 10,001+ employees; ERIC; Telecommunications industry

November 1996 – November 1997 (1 year 1 month)
Genoa Area, Italy

Frame Relay Bridge equipment
Bridge system interconnecting OSI layer-2 networks, supporting X25 and Frame Relay.
• Boot firmware development, in Assembly
• Frame Relay protocol development
• Node Jamming Handling
[Tools: Motorola MPC860 PowerPC, C, Assembly]

January 1996 – November 1996 (11 months)
Genoa Area, Italy

Air conditioning system for Army Shelter
Software Development of a cooling system to control the temperature inside of an army shelter.
• Development of software to supply the air temperature control, operating pumps, relays and monitoring sensors
• Text-based GUI to monitor the real-time state of the system
[Tools: Motorola 8751, Assembly, C]

Degree in Electronic Engineering (equivalent to Master ́s Degree), University of Genova (Italia). Graduated with 102/110 at pointing value. Experimental thesis "design and realization of a remote teaching on a packed network".
